radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple low-density lesions throughout the liver suggestive of metastatic disease; bilateral adrenal nodules increased slightly in size.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Adrenal nodules increased slightly in size from previous studies.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Two nodules in each lung, 2 to 4 mm in diameter, with paratracheal and subcarinal lymph nodes present.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: New pulmonary nodules that had not been present on a study 6 years earlier.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Mass in the region of the pelvis consistent with recurrent prostatic cancer.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Mass was present on admission but was obscured in initial imaging.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Intense uptake of FDG in the liver metastases and bony metastases.
Multiple abnormal foci of radiotracer uptake in the bones indicating bony metastases.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Newly seen sclerotic lesions on CT scan consistent with progression of bony disease.
